alert.note: Alert for Chase; Marion (Kansas) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Severe Weather Statement issued July 04 at 11:56PM CDT until July 05 at 1:00AM CDT by NWS Wichita
info.description: ...A SEVERE THUNDERSTORM WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 1245 AM CDT FOR EASTERN HARVEY...CHASE...NORTHERN BUTLER...MARION AND NORTHERN GREENWOOD COUNTIES... At 1155 PM CDT, severe thunderstorms were located along a line extending from 9 miles west of Emporia to near Walton, moving south at 25 mph. HAZARD...50 to 60 mph wind gusts, and pea to penny size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Expect damage to roofs, siding, and trees. Locations impacted include... Newton, Hesston, Hillsboro, Marion, North Newton, Peabody, Cottonwood Falls, Whitewater, Madison, Strong City, Florence, Goessel, Potwin, Hamilton, Walton, Elbing, Burns, Lehigh, Cassoday and Bazaar. HAIL THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX HAIL SIZE...0.75 IN WIND THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX WIND GUST...60 MPH
info.instruction: For your protection move to an interior room on the lowest floor of a building. Torrential rainfall is occurring with these storms, and may lead to flash flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways.
